intro: Lipochaeta alata var. acrior, commonly known as the hairy lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which provide protection against environmental stress. It produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in a disc-like formation, typical of the Asteraceae family. This species is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid and semi-arid regions.
